column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Evaluate the Needs of a Senior
#Text=Age progression generally brings forth various issues regarding physical health , mental health , mobility and daily living .
#Text=Seniors typically value their independence and believe they would become a burden to family and friends if they were no longer self-reliant .
#Text=Learning to evaluate the needs of a senior citizen can help ease transitions from living healthy and self-sufficient to assisted living or home care if help is needed .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Observe daily living and note any significant changes that may need to be addressed with your senior loved one .
#Text=Respect their independence by offering assistance with daily living objectives .
#Text=Physical restrictions preparing meals or completing household tasks such as laundry .
#Text=Signs of neglect or elder abuse .
#Text=Maintaining schedule of medications .
#Text=Timeliness paying bills .
#Text=Keeping up with general appointments .
#Text=List possible needs for assistive technology that offers improved mobility , in addition to hearing and vision assistance .
#Text=Wheelchair access will require home remodeling that may include installing a wheelchair access ramp or modifying a bathroom .
#Text=Upgrade land-line and cell phones with hearing enhancements or larger buttons .
#Text=Provide walking and seating aids when mobility becomes difficult due to arthritis , after an injury , surgical procedure or other condition .
#Text=Consider assistive technology options for reading such as an electronic reader , audio and Braille .
#Text=Evaluate health for physical and mental changes .
#Text=Becoming involved in your elder loved one 's health care can help them feel secure about challenges ahead .
#Text=Health and wellness is a critical area that may need the guidance of a medical professional .
#Text=Assist in maintaining schedule of medications .
#Text=Supervise changes in medication or therapy .
#Text=Monitor significant shifts in mood such as extreme sadness , anger or irritability .
#Text=Notate changes or difficulty of mobility not observed previously .
#Text=Suggest group activities or therapy after the loss of a spouse .
#Text=Grief can go through stages that may include depression , withdrawal , guilt , blame and loss of appetite .
#Text=Include your senior loved one in family activities and celebrations .
#Text=Encourage participation in senior citizen programs .
#Text=Recommend individual or group grief counseling .
#Text=Offer to listen whenever he or she would like to talk .
#Text=Note changes in the way business is handled .
#Text=Paying bills and completing tax returns may become difficult or forgotten .
#Text=Patterned behavior may be a sign that assistance is needed .
#Text=Plan time to help with paying bills , grocery shopping or going to the bank .
#Text=Explain the risk of scams and how they can affect life .
#Text=Offer assistance with legal issues .
#Text=Record specific information when visiting your elder family member in a nursing facility .
#Text=Maintaining documentation of the living conditions , physical differences and personality changes may indicate signs of declining care or elder abuse .
#Text=Is he happy to see you with open arms or a handshake ?
#Text=Is the living environment clean ?
#Text=Is your loved one clean and properly dressed ?
#Text=Are there any bruises , scratches or pressures sores on their body ?
#Text=Is communication with staff pleasant or hesitant ?
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Contact your local Adult Protective Services ( APS ) if you believe you senior loved one is experiencing physical , emotional , sexual or financial abuse .
